00010 class ATOGrid
00011 {
00012     public:
00013         int axis1num;
00014         int axis2num;
00015         char dataunits[50];
00016         char axis1units[50];
00017         char axis2units[50];
00018         char moist[50];
00019 //        char fluxtype[50];
00020         ATOFluxType *flux;
00021         char type[50];
00022         float *axis1values;
00023         float *axis2values;
00024         float **values;
00025 
00026         bool linear;
00027     ATOGrid();
00028     ATOGrid(ATOGrid* grid);
00029     ~ATOGrid();
00030     bool Read(icsv* infile);
00031     void Write(ocsv* outfile, bool writelinear = false);
00032     double GetGridMax(double &xcoord,double &ycoord);
00033     double GetGridMin(double &xcoord,double &ycoord);
00034     float getValue(float xcoord, float ycoord);
00035     int getAxis1index(float xcoord);
00036     int getAxis2index(float ycoord);
00037     ATOGrid* ZoomGridX2(void);
00038 
00039     /**
00040      * compares the units, moist, and flux types of grids.  if they
00041      * all match, returns true, else false
00042      */
00043     bool matches(ATOGrid* other);
00044     /**
00045       * returns a new grid, matching this grid, based on the grid
00046       * values passed in the "other" parameter
00047       * will return grid "other" if they already match (are synched).
00048       * will return 0 if an error occurs.
00049       * by match, i men that matches(other) will return true,
00050       * and that both grids have the same axis header values
00051       * and in the same order.  if the criteria under matches(other)
00052       * fails, there is no way to convert grid "other" to synch up with
00053       * this one.
00054       */
00055     bool synchGrids(ATOGrid* other);
00056     /**
00057      * compares the axis headers of both grids (this and other).
00058      * each axis must have the same count of values, and each
00059      * of those values at the same index must be equivalent.
00060      */
00061     bool compareAxis(ATOGrid *other);
00062     /**
00063       * first verifies that this and other grid can be added (they
00064       * are of the same type and hold same axis values).  if the
00065       * types don't match, false is returned.  if the axis values
00066       * don't match, then a new interpolated grid is created
00067       * based on the other grid, with matching header values
00068       * to this grid.  in other words, it aligns the other grid with
00069       * this grid, so that they can be added.  the other grid
00070       * is not modified when this function exits.
00071       */
00072     bool add(ATOGrid* other);
00073     /**
00074      * returns the bounds of this grid.  return units will be that of type
00075      * axis1units for x, and axis1units for y, if type is null.
00076      * the type argument is useful for specifying which bounds you want to
00077      * get.  set type = "cartesian" if you want to return the bounding
00078      * box of all the points (thus the min and max returns will be in
00079      * cartesian, even if the grid is currently of type polar).  set type
00080      * to "polar" if you want a polar range surrounding all points.  a
00081      * polar range radius (specified by minX, maxX) will be between 0 and
00082      * n.  a polar degree range (specified by minY, maxY) will be equal to
00083      * or between 0 and 360.
00084      */
00085     void getBounds(float &minX, float &minY, float &maxX, float &maxY, const char *type=0);
00086     /**
00087      * returns true if polar, false if cartesian.  determines by looking at the
00088      * axis2units variable.  if it's deg then polar is true, else false (and thus
00089      * assumed to be cartesian).
00090      */
00091     bool isPolar();
00092     /**
00093      * convert the current grid.  sizeX and sizeY specify the new dimensions.
00094      * listX and listY specify new axis1 and axis 2 values, if desired.  if listX and
00095      * listY are null, sizeX and sizeY will be used to create new axis headers
00096      * of these sizes, based of existing values.
00097      * the type variable specifies the new grid type.  options are "polar", 
00098      * "cartesian", and 0.   if 0, the grid dimension conversion will keep values
00099      * in the same units.
00100      * the first four parameters can be left to 0,and the last parameter can
00101      * be of "polar" or "cartesian" to convert a polar grid to a cartesian grid,
00102      * and vise versa.
00103      */
00104     void convert(int sizeX, float *listX, int sizeY, float *listY, const char *type=0);
00105     /**
00106      * after read is called, this function is usually called directly after to turn the
00107      * linear input into a grid.  the axis values are estimated based on the input
00108      * linear coordinates to form a uniform grid.
00109      */
00110     void linearToGrid();
00111     /**
00112      * gets the closest three points to (x, y).  stores them in listX, listY.
00113      * if the actual point matching x, y is in the grid, this function returns
00114      * true, and the values in listX and listY may be invalid because the
00115      * function terminated early.  note that the grid should be bigger than 4
00116      * elements, so that (listX, listY) can be filled with proper values.
00117      * indexes are stored in listX, listY because the axis values can be
00118      * retrieved as fast as the value at those axis values (instead of calling
00119      * getvalue() with axis values).
00120      * the values x and y should be of the same units as axis1units and axis2units
00121      * respectivly.  closestThree will make appropriate conversions.
00122      */
00123     bool closestThree(float x, float y, int* listX, int* listY);
00124 };

00145     /**
00146      * first compares time and unit to assure the grids match up.
00147      * next searches other time period for grids matching in this
00148      * time period.  if they match, they are added.
00149      */
00150     bool add(ATOTimePeriod *other);

00152       * return a copy of this class, it's up to the user to delete
00153       * it.
00154       */
00155     ATOTimePeriod *copy();

00157     /**
00158       * i made numoutput private on purpose, because it should
00159       * never have public write priveledges.  the appendGrid
00160       * takes care of the numoutput variable, and if desired this
00161       * function can be used to get the value of it.
00162       */
00163     int getnumoutput() {return numoutput;}
00164     private:
00165         int numoutput;

00289     ATODataSet();
00290     ~ATODataSet();
00291     bool Read(icsv* infile);
00292     void Write(ocsv* outfile);
00293     bool add(ATODataSet *other);
00294     /**
00295       * returns the flux with the new flux name, based
00296       * on the old flux name.  the old flux name is the
00297       * one read from the file, and the new flux name
00298       * is the one created if the old flux name conflicted
00299       * with any other of the global flux names.  if
00300       * there was no confliction, then oldfluxname
00301       * should be the same as the new flux name.
00302       */
00303     ATOFluxType *getFlux(const char *oldfluxname);
00304     /**
00305       * similar to the global addFlux function, except
00306       * that no flux mergins is done.  this flux is just
00307       * appended to an member list of this object.
00308       *
00309       * returns true if flux type was added, false if not
00310       * (most likly cause it was already in there)
00311       */
00312     bool addFlux(ATOFluxType *flux);
00313 };
